column4: I thought msmtp was a drop-in replacement for sendmail i.e. you should pretend you're still using sendmail. What does ls -l /usr/bin/sendmail point to?
/usr/sbin/sendmail points to exim4
so you're running exim4 as well as msmtp?
I'm following this guide. http://klenwell.com/is/UbuntuCommandLineGmail
And it's not working
I use ssmtp with gmail instead, and it does work. http://www.nixtutor.com/linux/send-mail-with-gmail-and-ssmtp/
well I can send an email with msmtp
but this is about getting it to work with mailx
mailx is just a front end, it should work with any sendmail compatible backend, including exim4 and/or msmtp/ssmtp or even sendmail. Is there anything interesting in the mail logs /var/log/mail.*
I looked there. Just a bunch of spamd stuff. Also, I set the log for smstp to /tmp/msmtp.log and nothing shows up there
so nothing you can think of?
it's as if msmtp is being run without the parameters that mailx is setting
doesn't mailx have a -v (verbose) switch. Try it and see if there's anything obvious. Maybe pastebin the output?
yes it does but it doesn't log anything
this person solved it
but i can't figure what he means http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=780509&page=2
ok ya that solved it. i just needed a different package of mailx. god that was confusing
it's pretty appalling that there are two versions of mailx in different packages, and one works and the other doesn't...
that explains why I've never had a problem with ssmtp....
how can I set it up so that I can read my gmail via command line?
Not many people want to do that, but I found this on google: http://lifehacker.com/275404/access-gmail-from-the-command-line
